meanings.definition: Avoid or neglect (a duty or responsibility)
meanings.sent1: Tom tried to shirk his chores by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: Don't shirk your homework; it's important to learn.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to shirk its responsibility of catching mice by napping all day.
meanings.sent4: She cannot shirk her duty as a teacher to guide her students.
meanings.sent5: If you shirk your responsibilities, others may have to pick up the slack.

meanings.sent1: The student tried to shirk his test by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent2: It's not right to shirk your taxes; everyone must contribute.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to shirk gathering nuts by hiding in its tree.
meanings.sent4: You cannot shirk your responsibilities forever; they will catch up to you.
meanings.sent5: If you shirk your duties, you may face consequences in the future.

meanings.definition: To fail to fulfill or carry out (a task)
meanings.sent1: She will shirk her promise to help if she doesn't show up.
meanings.sent2: It's not good to shirk your commitments; people rely on you.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to shirk its job of cleaning by pretending to be broken.
meanings.sent4: You cannot shirk your duties and expect to succeed in life.
meanings.sent5: If you shirk your responsibilities, you may miss out on important opportunities.
